vision.notes: Eyes are present, but the extent of their functionality in the deep-sea environment is unknown. Body color suggests some visual sensitivity at larval/immature stages.

mechanoreception.notes: Likely important for detecting prey and predators in the deep sea. Body covered with tiny spicules that could enhance mechanosensitivity.

chemoreception.notes: Likely used for locating food in the deep sea. Common in fishes for prey detection.
